sentences.english: He teaches all liberal sciences and gives account of dead souls that died in sin.
sentences.chinese: 他各人文科學和教給到死，死在仲心靈。

sentences.english: Music brings my heart fairy air.
So dear friends , let's open our hearts and ears to enjoy music .
sentences.chinese: 親愛的朋友，讓我們敞開心靈和張開雙耳去感受音樂。

sentences.english: The regional crisis makes people tortured by heart blank and disorientation, and so on.
sentences.chinese: 出現信仰危機，人們普遍心靈空虛，迷失方向等等。

sentences.english: So I can totally understand why her students usually call her"Connie Mum".
sentences.chinese: 康妮教授正是這樣一位可以點燃學生心靈的好老師。

sentences.english: This is the hour of an ablution heart.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個洗禮心靈的時刻。

sentences.english: The different types of visual teleportation are.
sentences.chinese: 不同類型的可視化的心靈運輸是。

sentences.english: A true friend is someone who reaches for your hand and touches your heart.
sentences.chinese: 一個真正的朋友是向著你伸手，觸動你心靈的人。

sentences.english: The Sun Yat-Sen Mausoleum is like a huge green leaf that warms and comforts the heart of every people in Nanjing.
sentences.chinese: 中山陵象一片巨大的綠葉，溫潤着每個南京人的心靈。

sentences.english: A flame AAS method is employed for the determination of lead in a traditional patented medicinal preparation "Xinling Pill".
sentences.chinese: 採用火焰原子吸收光譜法測定中成藥心靈丸中的鉛。

sentences.english: Psionicists are limited to light armor and can use daggers and two -handed staffs.
sentences.chinese: 心靈術士僅能裝備輕甲並可使用匕首和雙手杖。

sentences.english: Starts to play hide-and-seek with the soul, perhaps chase.
sentences.chinese: 開始和心靈捉迷藏，或是追逐。

sentences.english: A lift your veil, once touched many hearts.
sentences.chinese: 一首掀起你的蓋頭來，曾打動了多少美好的心靈。

sentences.english: Touched, was infiltrating mind days better life, is to awaken the zen sound.
sentences.chinese: 打動，是浸潤心靈的天簌，是喚醒生命的禪音。

sentences.english: The Moon whispers in your heart like an old soul everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 那一輪清月，卻似神祕的心靈低語，如影隨形。

sentences.english: Then the mind itself has become the measureless.
sentences.chinese: 那時心靈本身就變成了那無限。

definition: immediately/at once/at that moment/at the moment
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
